Text.Value: Half this place cleared out when the sky lit up. I'm staying put until I know what's what - I suggest you do the same.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cautious

Text.Value: Rolan is dead.

EditorData.NodeContext: fists curling, quietly angry in her grief

Text.Value: Doesn't matter, does it? They're gone.

EditorData.NodeContext: voice distant, shellshocked in her grief

Text.Value: You might have saved us, but that doesn't mean I won't beat you to a bloody pulp.

EditorData.NodeContext: snapping at the player in her grief but it is halfhearted

Text.Value: I'm not the best at showing it, but I love Cal and Rolan to death. They're family - thank you for bringing us back together.

EditorData.NodeContext: voice thick with sincerity and gratitude for the player

Text.Value: For what? If we hadn't stayed in the grove, if we hadn't listened to you, Rolan might be alive.

EditorData.NodeContext: angry and lashing out at the player in her grief

Text.Value: We never should have come here. Helping these people was a mistake.

EditorData.NodeContext: bitter and angry in her grief

Text.Value: Anyone gives you shit, come to me - I'll sort them out.

EditorData.NodeContext: grateful to the player but also clearly happy to murder someone at the player's request

Text.Value: I'm sorry.
Don't. I'm grateful you saved me, but I'm a hair's breadth from pummelling everyone in this place. You can thank Rolan for that.

EditorData.NodeContext: lia has had a massive fight with rolan and is upset and utterly furious.

Text.Value: Do not try to stop me. I'm leaving and that's that.

EditorData.NodeContext: upset and angry, just wants to get out of there so she can grieve in peace

Text.Value: Now that I'm here, that I'm safe, it's finally sinking in.

EditorData.NodeContext: voice distant, barely processing the news

Text.Value: For what? I have nothing left.

EditorData.NodeContext: everyone she's ever love is dead

Text.Value: Maybe the light is good news, maybe not - who knows with this place?

EditorData.NodeContext: Cautious

Text.Value: We're done here.

EditorData.NodeContext: cold and distant in her grief

Text.Value: You won't see me again.

EditorData.NodeContext: she's planning to walk into the cursed darkness to die - alone

Text.Value: Wasn't enough though, was it?

EditorData.NodeContext: her brother is dead, lashing out at the player

Text.Value: Leave - I won't repeat myself.

EditorData.NodeContext: this is clearly a threat, utterly furious with the player

Text.Value: Just pray we never meet again - you slimy sack of shit.

EditorData.NodeContext: player has been cruel about rolan's death and lia is lashing out in her fury

Text.Value: Rolan and I were blessed with hot tempers, and without Cal... well, I'm glad you talked sense into us. Thank you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gratitude to player. She had a fight with rolan that was about to get ugly, and the player intervened.

Text.Value: Where is Rolan? Godsdammit.

EditorData.NodeContext: worried for rolan and frustrated that she can't find him
EditorData.logicalname: BUFFER: Needs to wait for full return

Text.Value: Cal dead, Rolan in the wind. This couldn't have gone more wrong.

EditorData.NodeContext: for the first time, lia doesn't know what to do. She's overwhelmed and feeling useless

Text.Value: Of course Rolan went looking for us! If you see him, send his arse back here - and fast.

EditorData.NodeContext: acting annoyed but she's actually worried sick

Text.Value: He died as he lived - stupidly.
Everyone I've ever loved is dead. I did this - I failed them.

EditorData.NodeContext: her grief is starting to overwhelm he, she blames herself and thinks she's worthless

Text.Value: It's my fault - we never should have stayed in the grove with these people. They were doomed from the start.

EditorData.NodeContext: blaming herself for rolan's death. Angry and grieving

Text.Value: I know. He's dead.

EditorData.NodeContext: voice distant, barely processing the news

Text.Value: I did what I could to save him.
Where is Rolan? If he's not dead, I'll kill him myself - by the gods.

EditorData.NodeContext: acting annoyed but she's actually worried sick

Text.Value: A little gratitude would be nice.
You and everyone in this dump can rot for all I damn care. And you will.

EditorData.NodeContext: player has been cruel about rolan's death and lia is lashing out in her fury

Synopsis: Lia has been rescued from Moonrise Towers by the player and is now in Last Light. This dialogue covers multiple states: Rolan is missing, Rolan is dead, Rolan and Lia had a fight (player must pass a persuade to calm the fight, pass and fail states here), and a general state for when cal, lia and rolan are all alive and well and Lia is grateful to the player.
